thread.title: 433 hot air balloons soar into the record books
thread.title_full: 433 hot air balloons soar into the record books

title: 433 hot air balloons soar into the record books
text:
Monday, July 27, 2015 433 hot air balloons soar into the record books Hot-air balloons fly near Chambley-Bussieres airbase, eastern France, on July 26, 2015, on the first day of the international air-balloon meeting "Lorraine Mondial Air Ballons". PHOTO | AFP Hot-air balloons are seen near Chambley-Bussieres airbase, eastern France, on July 26, 2015, on the first day of the international air-balloon meeting "Lorraine Mondial Air Ballons". PHOTO | AFP Photo gallery In Summary The balloons, including some spectacular designs such as a French chateau and rotund cartoon character Obelix, took off from Chambley-Bussieres air base to beat the previous record for simultaneous hot air balloon flights.   
CHAMBLEY-BUSSIÃˆRES Four hundred thirty-three hot air balloons lifted off from an air base in eastern France on Sunday and soared straight into the record books. The balloons, including some spectacular designs such as a French chateau and rotund cartoon character Obelix, took off from Chambley-Bussieres air base to beat the previous record for simultaneous hot air balloon flights. 
Hot-air balloons fly near Chambley-Bussieres airbase, eastern France, on July 26, 2015, on the first day of the international air-balloon meeting "Lorraine Mondial Air Ballons". PHOTO | AFP The previous record was set at the same spot in 2013 when 391 ballons went up. "A new page in ballooning history has been written," said Philippe Buron-Pilatre, organiser of the twice-yearly Lorraine Mondial Air Ballons event. The biggest dangers for the balloons, which were arrayed in parallel lines six kilometres (four miles) long for the take off, was that two of them might collide causing tears in their fabric, something that has happened twice since 1989, he added. 
Hot-air balloons fly near Chambley-Bussieres airbase, eastern France, on July 26, 2015, on the first day of the international air-balloon meeting "Lorraine Mondial Air Ballons". PHOTO | AFP Enthusiasts from over 40 nations took part. advertisement
